Course Name: ACG 3842 - ACCOUNTING APPLICATIONS OF DATA ANALYTICS
Prerequisites: ACG 2071 AND SATISFACTORY PERFORMANCE ON PRINCIPLES OF ACCOUNTING COMPETENCY EXAM
Course Description: APPLICATIONS OF DATA ANALYTICS IN AUDITING, MANAGERIAL ACCOUNTING AND FINANCIAL STATEMENT ANALYSIS.
Objectives / Learning Outcome(s) / Major:
AT THE END OF THE COURSE, THE STUDENT WILL:

1. GAIN AN APPRECIATION OF WHAT IT TAKES TO HAVE "AN ANALYTICS MINDSET"; AND
2. GAIN HANDS-ON SKILLS IN APPLYING DATA ANALYTICS IN ACCOUNTING CASES.
Textbook(s): RICHARDSON, TEETER & TERRELL. DATA ANALYTICS FOR ACCOUNTING. MCGRAW HILL.
Transfer Status: GUARANTEED TRANSFER TO INSTITUTION OFFERING SAME COURSE.
